ygData.subject: Text history loss when switching screen modes
ygData.msgSnippet: It seems that Verant has inadvertantly screwed bards again... After the patch last week that added the text wrapping feature (and caused a slowdown when
ygData.messageBody:
It seems that Verant has inadvertantly screwed bards again...

After the patch last week that added the text wrapping feature (and caused a
slowdown when switching from full screen to windowed; ie. going into
inventory, looting, spell book, etc.) the text in my chat history box would
sometimes disappear. It would only happen once in a while, however, so it
was not that big of a deal.

Last night however, we were doing a practice Kaesora raid with mostly guild
members, and EVERY time I switched from full screen to windowed, my chat
history text would dissapear. Someone in my group mentioned that he only
noticed that problem when grouped with a bard.

I think I'll post this same message on Verant's official message board, not
that they'll notice it, but at least it'll be there.. hehe

Olgwinn Pendragun
Bard of 42 Missed Notes
Crimson Legacy, E'ci


> Date: Thu, 31 Aug 2000 16:15:00 -0500
> From: Khelan<khelan@...>
>Subject: Re: eqclient.ini tweaks
>
>I've tweaked mine out to where I'm very comfortable with it. You can get
>it at www.clandlc.com/files/eqclient.ini
>
>There are a lot of pastels and light colors in this one, that's because I
>play in full screen mode and most've the places I play in are dark. It's
>hard to read some of the text in windowed mode, but the text that you have
>to read in that mode is black (Merchant buy/sells). I've found that in the
>zones that are lighter or foggy zones (like Burning Woods sometimes), all
>you have to do to read the text again is toggle on the Transparent Polys (~
>key).
>
>I'd like to know what some of you all think (and if you have color
>suggestions, please tell me).
>
>BTW, anyone else notice their text disappearing when changing from windowed
>to full-screen mode and vice versa?
>
>Enjoy!
>
>--Khelan Stormblood, Bard of 35 songs
>GuildMaster Temporal Crusaders, Tarew Marr
